instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message:
Hey all. Got this board come in...

This one got a hole in the PCB - gone pretty deep.

First time I seen this.

My question is: should i even bother? wouldnt all the traces inside be gone/many broken lines?
What would you guys do with something like this? Donor pile?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message: As in a drill hole?? That sounds like a donor board to me lmao

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message: Depends on where the hole is.....picture plz.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message:
strange. i cant upload image however i have done on the forums before without issues

yeah so it looks it exploded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message:
High chance 12.6V made it to the GPU, since <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> blew up.

However you can isolate <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> and run wires everywhere. You'll need a new home for <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> as wires need to run to this FET.

If you do achieve this you'll need luck the GPU wont need to be replaced.

I would pass on this,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message: thanks for that. sounds like too much work... its going to the donor pile :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B is there any hope for this guy?
threads.message: Nope this is a pile of shit.
